intro: Urera sandwicensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian urera, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a shrub that typically grows in moist, shaded areas of rainforests. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant yellow flowers. It is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in its native range.
